intro: Zanthoxylum campicola, commonly known as the mountain prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Its bark and leaves contain compounds that have been used in traditional medicine for their potential anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. Zanthoxylum campicola thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and rocky slopes.
